result.execSummary:
The defendant Timmy Lee Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Barron County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Must report to Probation within 48 hours
Concurrent with: any sentence currently serving

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is allowed to expire or is revoked with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge and provide current financial information.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for any balances due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Must maintain absolute sobriety.  
Must not possess controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed physician and taken as prescribed.

Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent.
Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail on Tuesday/Thursday, before December 7, 2016, between 1:00 and 5:00 PM, to submit DNA sample.

Defendant Timmy Lee Johnson in court with attorney Scott S. Schlough.  Angela Lynn Beranek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Covers 15CM265, 15CM286 and 16CM116.  State recites agreement.  Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights presented and discussed.

15CM265 - Guilty plea entered

15CM286
Count 2 Guilty plea entered
Counts 1 and 3 are Dismissed and Read In

16CM116 - Guilty plea entered

The Court finds plea is knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily given and finds the defendant guilty.  Attorney Schlough relates.  Defendant relates.  Court relates and orders:

SW - 2 years Probation - Concurrent with any sentence presenting serving - Report to Probation within 48 hours
Must complete any and all evaluations, counseling, treatment and follow-up recommended by Probation Agent
Must maintain absolute sobriety
Must not possess controlled substances unless prescribed by a licensed physician and taken as prescribed
Court costs including DNA surcharge  

Order for DNA given to the defendant in court. Must report to Barron County Jail on a Tuesday or Thursday before December 7, 2016 between 1:00 and 5:00 PM, to submit DNA sample.
